articles.title: The Displace Hub can make your normal TV wireless
articles.description: Displace first tried its hand at reimagining the TV in 2023, with a wireless screen that suctions onto walls and features built-in rechargeable batteries. At CES 2026, the company is not only introducing new versions of its own TVs, it's also showing off the Displace Hub , an accessory that can
articles.content: Displace first tried its hand at reimagining the TV in 2023, with a wireless screen that suctions onto walls and features built-in rechargeable batteries. At CES 2026, the company is not only introducing new versions of its own TVs, it's also showing off the Displace Hub , an accessory that can make other TVs wireless. The Displace Hub is a wall-mounting system with some extra bells and whistles. It combines the "active-loop suction" of Displace’s TVs, with a rechargeable battery that can po
articles.author: Ian Carlos Campbell

articles.title: Google’s Gemini app can check videos to see if they were made with Google AI
articles.description: Google expanded Gemini's AI verification feature to videos made or edited with the company's own AI models. Users can now ask Gemini to determine if an uploaded video is AI-generated by asking, "Was this generated using Google AI?" Gemini will scan the video's visuals and audio for Google's propriet
articles.content: Google expanded Gemini's AI verification feature to videos made or edited with the company's own AI models. Users can now ask Gemini to determine if an uploaded video is AI-generated by asking, "Was this generated using Google AI?" Gemini will scan the video's visuals and audio for Google's proprietary watermark called SynthID . The response will be more than a yes or no, Google says. Gemini will point out specific times when the watermark appears in the video or audio. The company rolled out th
articles.author: Elissa Welle

articles.title: The Ultra-Realistic AI Face Swapping Platform Driving Romance Scams
articles.description: Capable of creating “nearly perfect” face swaps during live video chats, Haotian has made millions, mainly via Telegram. But its main channel vanished after WIRED's inquiry into scammers using the app.
articles.content: Capable of creating “nearly perfect” face swaps during live video chats, Haotian has made millions, mainly via Telegram. But its main channel vanished after WIRED's inquiry into scammers using the app.

articles.description: Apple just announced it will be integrating more ads into the App Store because our poor eyeballs must be assaulted at all times. The company plans on littering search results with advertisements beginning next year . Currently, the App Store only has one ad spot. That's at the very top of searc
articles.content: Apple just announced it will be integrating more ads into the App Store because our poor eyeballs must be assaulted at all times. The company plans on littering search results with advertisements beginning next year . Currently, the App Store only has one ad spot. That's at the very top of search results. If you search for something like Instagram it's likely that top spot will be filled with an ad for a rival social media platform. The new ads will appear further down the actual search
articles.author: Lawrence Bonk

articles.title: Auto chip shortage: Honda will pause production in Japan and China
articles.description: The ripples of the auto industry's chip shortage are still being felt, as evidenced by Honda. Bloomberg reported on Wednesday that the automaker will suspend production in Japan on January 5 and 6. (Honda didn't specify the affected factories.) In addition, all three of the automaker's G
articles.content: The ripples of the auto industry's chip shortage are still being felt, as evidenced by Honda. Bloomberg reported on Wednesday that the automaker will suspend production in Japan on January 5 and 6. (Honda didn't specify the affected factories.) In addition, all three of the automaker's Guangqi Honda Automobile plants in China will shut down from December 29 to January 2. The halt is an outgrowth of a chip shortage stemming from a recent geopolitical proxy war in the Netherlands, of a
articles.author: Will Shanklin

articles.title: Why Your Model is Failing (Hint: It’s Not the Architecture)
articles.description: We’ve all been there. You spend days tuning hyperparameters and tweaking your architecture, but the loss curve just won’t cooperate. In my experience, the difference between a successful project and a failure is rarely the model architecture. It’s almost always the data pipeline. I recently built a
articles.content: We’ve all been there. You spend days tuning hyperparameters and tweaking your architecture, but the loss curve just won’t cooperate. In my experience, the difference between a successful project and a failure is rarely the model architecture. It’s almost always the data pipeline. I recently built a robust data pipeline solution for a private work project. While I can’t share that proprietary data due to privacy reasons, the challenges I faced are universal: messy file structures, proprietary lab
articles.author: Nastaran Moghadasi

articles.title: Why I Wrote AI Coding Guidelines and You Should Too
articles.description: We recently hired someone we already knew well. We’d worked together before, trusted him, and liked how he approached problems. He has that entrepreneurial mindset, he sees something that needs doing and just does it . That’s the main reason why we hired him. He’s is not ultra experienced and so use
articles.content: We recently hired someone we already knew well. We’d worked together before, trusted him, and liked how he approached problems. He has that entrepreneurial mindset, he sees something that needs doing and just does it . That’s the main reason why we hired him. He’s is not ultra experienced and so uses Cursor a lot. That’s not a problem, because we do too. Cursor is a great tool and it clearly accelerates development. Speed is the holy grail of every startup. What we started noticing, though, wasn
articles.author: Alexander Gekov

articles.title: C# Minimal API: Response Caching
articles.description: Response Caching Response caching reduces the number of requests a client or proxy makes to a web server. Response caching also reduces the amount of work the web server performs to generate a response. Response caching is set in headers. ( Microsoft Docs ) Response caching is configured using the C
articles.content: Response Caching Response caching reduces the number of requests a client or proxy makes to a web server. Response caching also reduces the amount of work the web server performs to generate a response. Response caching is set in headers. ( Microsoft Docs ) Response caching is configured using the Cache-Control header, which allows responses to be cached on the client or along the way, for example on a proxy. Response Caching in Minimal APIs In ASP.NET Core MVC, response caching is typically con
articles.author: Daniel Balcárek

articles.title: The Verge’s favorite holiday gifts under $100
articles.description: Between all the new phones, smartwatches, and laptops we see throughout the year, it often feels like we're constantly being nudged toward shinier, more expensive gadgets. And I get it. As a self-professed gadget nerd, few things are more exciting than unboxing and setting up a new device. But the t
articles.content: Between all the new phones, smartwatches, and laptops we see throughout the year, it often feels like we're constantly being nudged toward shinier, more expensive gadgets. And I get it. As a self-professed gadget nerd, few things are more exciting than unboxing and setting up a new device. But the truth is, you can still find plenty of great gifts for under $100. I use the Leatherman Free T4 every day , while Donkey Kong Bananza has provided me (and other Verge staffers ) with hours of entertain
articles.author: Brandon Russell

articles.title: NeuralDSP models John Mayer’s entire amp and effects rig—and it sounds great
articles.description: Mayer gets the "Archetype" treatment.
articles.content: Guitarists today are spoiled for choice, and that goes doubly true for players who use computer-based amp modeling software. I’m one such player, and I don’t miss the size, weight, deafening volume, or cost of owning an amp and cabinet collection, to say nothing of all those pedals and cables. For clean to mid-gain tones alone, I already have more terrific options than I need, including NeuralDSP’s Tone King and Cory Wong and Mateus Asato , PolychromeDSP’s Lumos , and Universal Audio’s new Parad
articles.author: Nate Anderson

articles.description: A foldable phone isn’t for the faint of heart. They’re generally heavier, pricier, and have less capable cameras than a standard slab-style phone. They’re also still not as durable as regular smartphones, though they’re not nearly as fragile as they once were. In fact, thanks to Google, we finally h
articles.content: A foldable phone isn’t for the faint of heart. They’re generally heavier, pricier, and have less capable cameras than a standard slab-style phone. They’re also still not as durable as regular smartphones, though they’re not nearly as fragile as they once were . In fact, thanks to Google, we finally have a foldable phone we can take with us to the beach. There are basically two kinds of foldables at the moment — the kind that fold like books and the ones that fold clamshell style, like your old f
articles.author: Allison Johnson

articles.description: This is today’s edition of The Download, our weekday newsletter that provides a daily dose of what’s going on in the world of technology. The 8 worst technology flops of 2025 Welcome to our annual list of the worst, least successful, and simply dumbest technologies of the year. We like t
articles.content: This is today’s edition of The Download , our weekday newsletter that provides a daily dose of what’s going on in the world of technology. The 8 worst technology flops of 2025 Welcome to our annual list of the worst, least successful, and simply dumbest technologies of the year. We like to think there’s a lesson in every technological misadventure. But when technology becomes dependent on power, sometimes the takeaway is simpler: it would have been better to stay away. Regrets—2025 h
articles.author: Rhiannon Williams

articles.title: Does swearing make you stronger? Science says yes.
articles.description: "A calorie-neutral, drug-free, low-cost, readily available tool for when we need a boost in performance.”
articles.content: If you’re human, you’ve probably hollered a curse word or two (or three) when barking your shin on a table edge or hitting your thumb with a hammer. Perhaps you’ve noticed that this seems to lessen your pain. There’s a growing body of scientific evidence that this is indeed the case. The technical term is the “ hypoalgesic effect of swearing. ” Cursing can also improve physical strength and endurance, according to a new paper published in the journal American Psychologist. As previously reported
articles.author: Jennifer Ouellette

articles.description: In just a couple of weeks, we’ll be bidding farewell to 2025. And what a year it has been! Artificial intelligence is being incorporated into more aspects of our lives, weight-loss drugs have expanded in scope, and there have been some real “omg” biotech stories from the fields of gene therapy, IVF,
articles.content: In just a couple of weeks, we’ll be bidding farewell to 2025. And what a year it has been! Artificial intelligence is being incorporated into more aspects of our lives, weight-loss drugs have expanded in scope, and there have been some real “omg” biotech stories from the fields of gene therapy , IVF , neurotech , and more . As always, the team at MIT Technology Review has been putting together our 2026 list of breakthrough technologies . That will be published in the new year (watch this space).
articles.author: Jessica Hamzelou

articles.title: LG forced a Copilot web app onto its TVs but will let you delete it
articles.description: LG says it will let users delete the Microsoft Copilot shortcut it installed on newer TVs after several reports highlighted the unremovable icon. In a statement to The Verge, LG spokesperson Chris De Maria says the company "respects consumer choice and will take steps to allow users to delete the sh
articles.content: LG says it will let users delete the Microsoft Copilot shortcut it installed on newer TVs after several reports highlighted the unremovable icon. In a statement to The Verge , LG spokesperson Chris De Maria says the company "respects consumer choice and will take steps to allow users to delete the shortcut icon if they wish." Last week, a user on the r/mildlyinfuriating subreddit posted an image of the Microsoft Copilot icon in their lineup of apps on an LG TV, with no option to delete it. "My L
articles.author: Emma Roth

articles.title: NASA will soon find out if the Perseverance rover can really persevere on Mars
articles.description: Engineers at JPL are certifying the Perseverance rover to drive up to 100 kilometers.
articles.content: When the Perseverance rover arrived on Mars nearly five years ago, NASA officials thought the next American lander to take aim on the red planet would be taking shape by now. At the time, the leaders of the space agency expected this next lander could be ready for launch as soon as 2026—or more likely in 2028. Its mission would have been to retrieve Martian rock specimens collected by the Perseverance rover, then billed as the first leg of a multilaunch, multibillion-dollar Mars Sample Return ca
articles.author: Stephen Clark

articles.title: The 8 worst technology flops of 2025
articles.description: Welcome to our annual list of the worst, least successful, and simply dumbest technologies of the year. This year, politics was a recurring theme. Donald Trump swept back into office and used his executive pen to reshape the fortunes of entire sectors, from renewables to cryptocurrency. The wrecking
articles.content: Welcome to our annual list of the worst, least successful, and simply dumbest technologies of the year. This year, politics was a recurring theme. Donald Trump swept back into office and used his executive pen to reshape the fortunes of entire sectors, from renewables to cryptocurrency. The wrecking-ball act began even before his inauguration, when the president-elect marketed his own memecoin, $TRUMP, in a shameless act of merchandising that, of course, we honor on this year’s worst tech list.
articles.author: Antonio Regalado

articles.title: For the lazy techie: These are Ars staff’s last-minute holiday gift picks
articles.description: Two wireless mice, two external hard drives, and a partridge in a pear tree.
articles.content: The holidays have snuck up on us. How is it already that time? If you’re on top of things and have already bought all your Christmas gifts, I commend you. Not all of us are so conscientious. In fact, one of us is so behind on holiday prep that he is not only running late on buying gifts; he’s also behind on publishing the Ars staff gift guide he said he’d write. (Whoever could we be talking about?) So for my fellow last-minute scramblers, I polled Ars writers and editors for gift ideas they know
articles.author: Samuel Axon
